abstract: Both Apple and AT&T acknowledged that some customers have had problems activating their phones to connect to the AT&T cellular network.
snippet: Both Apple and AT&T acknowledged that some customers have had problems activating their phones to connect to the AT&T cellular network.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, July 1 — Apple’s long awaited iPhone began selling briskly on Friday evening, but press officers at both Apple and AT&T acknowledged that some customers have had problems activating their phones to connect to the AT&T cellular network.

headline.main: For iPhone, Some Shortages and Activation Problems
headline.print_headline: For iPhone, Some Shortages and Activation Problems

abstract: AT&T said this afternoon that in partnership with Apple the nation’s largest cellular operator had sold more iPhones over the weekend than any of previous phone models have sold in a month. It also said this morning that they are making progress in smoothing out the glitches that had bedeviled some users who attempted to used the system used to activate the phones using the Internet.

lead_paragraph: AT&T said this afternoon that in partnership with Apple the nation’s largest cellular operator had sold more iPhones over the weekend than any of previous phone models have sold in a month.

headline.main: AT&T Says the iPhone Is Its Best Seller Ever
